Package anydev

Interface Column

All Known Implementing Classes:
Column_Boolean, Column_Date, Column_Double, Column_Enum, Column_Integer, Column_String
public interface Column
Defines all column types that exist. By default, any column prohibits null and empty cells and has no default values. Use the available (optional) allowXXX() methods to override these. You always start creating a new column via named(...). You always finish with create()

    • getObjectToAdd

      default Object getObjectToAdd(Object objectToAdd)
      Parameters:
      objectToAdd - the object you are trying to add to the Column implementing this interface
      Returns:
      the object that can be added to the column. Can be given objectToAdd or column's default value or null, depending on objectToAdd and the column definition
      Throws:
      ERROR - if given object is null and null is not allowed
      ERROR - if given value is not valid for the column and not default value was defined

    • forBoolean

      static Column_Boolean.ColumnBooleanBuilder forBoolean(String name)
      Start creating a new Boolean-column
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the column. Must be "database-ready", i.e. not null, not empty, all lower-case and no spaces

      Parameters:

      enumClass - which enum must be matched by column data? Use as myEnum.class for an enum named myEnum
